intro: Saccus mariannensis, commonly known as the Mariana sac, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mariana Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, sac-like floral structure. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture. Due to habitat loss, Saccus mariannensis is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
